definition[0]: moving or doing things in a careless way, especially so that you drop things, knock into things etc
example[0]: A clumsy waiter spilled wine all over her new skirt.
example[1]: a clumsy attempt to catch the ball
definition[1]: a clumsy object is not easy to use and is often large and heavy
definition[2]: a clumsy action or statement is said or done carelessly or badly, and likely to upset someone
example[2]: David made a clumsy attempt to comfort us.
example[3]: She was very clumsy and was always walking into doors.
example[4]: With clumsy fingers he took out a pack of cigarettes and tried to light one.
definition[3]: moving in a way that does not seem relaxed or comfortable
example[5]: Her husband always looked a bit awkward when he was dancing.
definition[4]: moving in a way that is not graceful – used especially about people or things that are big
example[7]: The ostrich is rather an ungainly bird.
example[8]: She collapsed into the chair in an ungainly manner.
definition[5]: not able to control your movements very well, and therefore not very good at physical activities
example[9]: When she first starting playing tennis, her movements were slow and uncoordinated.
example[10]: I was very accident-prone as a child and was always having to go to hospital.
definition[7]: to be unable to control your fingers very well, so that you cannot do something
example[11]: ‘Do you want some help unwrapping that?’ ‘Yes please, I’m all fingers and thumbs today.’
